channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+2067] Hi AT&T? Yeah, My Reception …
[+1412] WikiLeaks founder no longer suspected of rape- that was fast
item.description: The warrant for the arrest of WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has been withdrawn, after chief prosecutor Eva Finné ruled that there were no grounds to suspect that he had committed rape, the Swedish prosecutor's office has confirmed. And yet it the accusatory article made Digg's top ten in, what, 3 hours. Let's see if this even makes front page.

item.title: [+1324] US Soldiers Punished For Refusing To Attend Christian Concer
item.description: Private Anthony Smith is the type of guy who stands up for what he believes in. That's why he decided to hold his commanding officers accountable for punishing him and fellow soldiers after they refused to attend an evangelical Christian rock concert at the Fort Eustis military post in Virginia.

item.title: [+1298] Franken goes ballistic on Verizon, Google, Comcast, and NBCU
item.description: Senator Al Franken (D-MN) had choice words for the Google/Verizon net neutrality plan, and none of them were good. Speaking at a public hearing on Thursday, Franken also called called the proposed merger of Comcast and NBCU "very, very dangerous".

item.title: [+1272] 3 Reasons the Ground Zero Mosque Debate Makes No Sense
item.description: I don't usually write about politics. It's important, but something I want no part of -- kind of like a raw sewage treatment facility. But frankly, I haven't been this upset in a long time. And it's due to the logic-hating, herd-mentality rhetoric that some have been flinging in opposition to the so-called 'Ground Zero Mosque.'

item.title: [+1126] Jon Stewart Ties Rupert Murdoch to Terrorism (Video)
item.description: On last night's Daily Show, in response to flimsy attempts by the Fox News gang to link the Imam behind the so-called Ground Zero Mosque to terrorism, Jon Stewart used the same tactics to connect Rupert Murdoch to Osama bin Laden.

item.title: [+1120] Ultraviolet light reveals how Greek statues really looked
item.description: Original Greek statues were brightly painted, but after thousands of years, those paints have worn away. Find out how shining a light on the statues can be all that's required to see them as they were thousands of years ago.

item.title: [+805] DUI Charge Dropped Against Officer Who Killed 1 & Injured 2
item.description: A prosecutor said Thursday he is dropping drunken driving charges against an Indianapolis police officer accused in a crash that killed a motorcyclist because - Blood sample was drawn at a clinic rather than a hospital, as required by law!!!!!

item.title: [+797] Russia In Color, a Century Ago [PICS]
item.description: With images from southern and central Russia in the news lately due to extensive wildfires, I thought it would be interesting to look back in time with this extraordinary collection of color photographs taken between 1909 and 1912.

item.title: [+758] BADASS PENGUINS [PIC]
[+723] Shot Fired Into Al Frankens Home
item.description: Nobody was home at the time of the incident, which was not reported until after the senator and his wife returned home to Minneapolis after a two-day trip out of town on Tuesday and discovered the damage to their window facing the street.

item.title: [+655] Futurama Writer Created And Proved A Brand New Math Theorem
item.description: We all knew the writing staff of Futurama was brainy but this is something else. To work out the ridiculous brain switching plot line from last night's hilarious episode, writer Ken Keeler (who also just happens to have a PhD in mathematics) ended up writing and proving an entirely new theorem. This is probably the most impressive bit of side work

item.title: [+580] Supreme Court told P2P users can be 'innocent infringers'
item.description: A group of law professors has filed a brief with the Supreme Court, arguing that it's patently ridiculous for copyright notices on compact discs--which P2P users never see--to count as "knowledge" of infringement.

item.title: [+512] 15 Strange Things About Outer Space
item.description: Space is one damn interesting place, chock-full of wacky phenomena, and you don’t even need to work for NASA to understand it. Here’s a collection of interesting and altogether weird space facts that you probably didn’t learn in school or even on TV.

item.title: [+414] 15 Facts About Net Neutrality [Infographic]
item.description: Net neutrality has taken up a lot of headline space over the last two weeks. There was the Goggle and Verizon thing, and then something happened with the FCC and some Congress members, and the French may have been involved somehow... Admit it, your eyes are glazing over aren't they?

item.title: [+412] Fine Ticketmaster, You Win [PIC]
[+411] Sex, Drugs, and Techno Aboard a Politicians Yacht
item.description: A former stewardess on US Senate candidate's Jeff Greene’s yacht tells her tale. The story includes (but is not limited to) serving Mike Tyson alcohol while he got a blow job.

item.title: [+409] A 'Double Planet' Seen From Mercury
item.description: For the first time we see Earth 114 million miles outward from Mercury.

item.title: [+407] Ceelo Green's New Song is Incredible (Music Video)
item.description: Cee-Lo Green is angry at his woman. Like, so angry. And he’s got a profanity laced anthem called "F*ck You" to prove it.

item.title: [+401] Young, obese girls taken from filthy, bug-ridden home
item.description: When police walked into the home, they found a 5-year-old girl weighing nearly 160 pounds, her teeth rotting, her skin covered in spider bites. Her 4-year-old sister was lying on a filthy mattress, wearing only a urine-soaked diaper.
